comment: Dr. Pierre is the bomb.com!  I enjoyed his class.  He has practical teaching methods.  He gets rid of the fluff and tells you exactly how it is in the field. I learned so much from him and I wish he taught other subjects!  Take him if you can!

At first I didn't think I could handle his class. The topics discussed are so polarizing and you can pretty much guess which way he leans by the way he presents them. However, I did get along with him even though we disagreed on things. He is helpful and I would recommend him to anyone!

Initially I butted heads a lot with this professor, but I learned more in this class about myself and as a future educator than any other class I've taken at KSU. He pushes you out of your comfort zone, and challenges you to think. He really does care about his students, and respects others opinions. I would highly recommend him.

Loved the professor, hated the students! I wish I could have chosen who could register for the class. Who you take a class with makes a big difference. I had Dr. Pierre before and his class was so much fun, although I learned a lot I wish I taken the class with another group of students.
Overall class was helpful. Loved the mock IEP, especially when Dr. Pierre played dayday. Enjoyed reading about Joey Pigza, the series showed me how special education students think.
I loved coming to class, I learned a lot about my self and the challenges of teaching. Wish we saw more of Black White, I recommend him as a professor at KSU.
Wonderful instructor loved his teaching style, hated some of the students in the class and their comments, but enjoyed the material and Dr. Pierre.

Shows up late constantly, he even showed up late to the final. Grades the paper harsh which is the only thing that gets "graded". Nothing is accomplished in class and he does not prepare you for the real world.
Dr. Pierre gives a practical view of the teaching profession. The mock IEP's were the best, especially when he played DayDay. I learned alot!
Dr. Pierre is very helpful, fair and competent. His exams are difficult because he expects you to figure out scenarios. His class is interesting, I recommended him as a professor.
The best professor in the education department by far. Dr. Pierre gave us a realistic view of education and diversity.
